intro: Tococa ulei f. parvivesicosa, commonly known as the small blister tococa, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Amazon rainforest of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. It is often found growing in humid, shaded environments within the understory of dense tropical forests.
